data.title: A great place for a concert
data.text: Beautiful theatre in downtown Kansas City.  If you have not visited the Folly or Kansas City please do. Christmas on The Plaza to see the lighting ceremony is awesome!

data.title: GOOD VENUE FOR PERFORMANCES
data.text:
We have been here before for various performances. All seats are good. 
They have quite a variety of performers here. From music to ballet to jazz & many others.
The ushers here are volunteers & are very nice & friendly.  
There is a small snack bar in the lobby for a quick coffee, drink, cookie, etc.
You need to check online to see what they have going on & when. It's not like you can go any day & expect a performance.
The prices for tickets are reasonable.

data.title: First time
data.text:
Being new to the area, this was the first time my boyfriend and I attended a Harriman-Jewell Concert. During the concert, I noticed all the exquisite wood designs in the moldings and light fixtures. Not knowing the history of the Folly Theatre prior to attending, I wondered how old it was and what the walls would say. 
During intermission my architect boyfriend and I discussed our thoughts of the building. I thought this building was around 1890- early 1900 and DBF said maybe 1910's. We spoke with one of the guides and it was built in 1900. Boy does this place have a past!! They did a great job at restoring it. 

The restrooms are modern yet everything else is restored. Friendly staff. Great location. Parking garage is right next door. Parking is tight, so leave the big trucks and SUVs at home. We were glad we left our truck at home and took my sedan.

data.title: Beautiful Historic Theatre
data.text: Gorgeous lobby and venue right downtown, easy location. Great place to see a show. We enjoyed our visit thoroughly.

data.title: Very Nice Theatre!
data.text: My Wife, Cousin, his Wife, & I all attended the Marcus Luttrell Patriot Tour here in September.  Our seats were the front row of the upper balcony, & the balcony hangs out so far that with those seats you are as close to the stage as the people in about the 8th row of the lower orchestra seating, and for over half less per ticket.  This is an old theatre, but it is well maintained.  My one, & only complaint is that they have absolutely no waiting area for before the time they let you go to your seats, and what little room there is in thr small lobby is taken up by the will call booth, a bar, & the area that they sell merchandise.  Waiting for them to let you go to your seats you had better hope your not claustrophobic.  Other than that the thrate is a very nice place to catch a performance.  Sound acoustics wereally very good.

data.title: excellent theatre
data.text: attended a Bill Shapiro Cypress Avenue rock and roll program with artistic dance. Music was good, narration very informative and the dancing ranged from great to fair. It was a one off show and worth seeing. good fun

data.title: Amazing show!
data.text: A group of friends and I drove here all the way from St. Louis to see Miranda Sings, a hilarious comedian. The venue was perfect and our vip tickets were well worth the money. We got special seating towards the front and the meet and greet was very intimate and worth the trip

data.title: great venue - all good seats
data.text:
We went to see Kelly Hunt perform & she was great.
Every seat is a good seat in this place.  The place is large enough to accommodate a decent crowd & yet small enough to feel intimate.
Everyone working here is so nice & friendly.
This is an indoor venue, close to major national hotel, if you want to stay & see & do more in the area.

data.title: Intimate, great parking, superb acoustics
data.text: This is an old theatre in KC that has been restored and has great charisma. The acoustics are excellent and there are no obstructed views. Went to see a couple of singer songwriters sponsored by Cypress Avenue and the local PBS radio station. The performance was riveting and the whole set up is easy. Covered parking where you can walk directly into the theatre, nice bar and an intimate setting. Very nice and very surprising.
